name: Days Inn Oxford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed overnight here as it was close to Oxford & I had to return a hire car the next day. Being at a service area meant I could fuel up and do the short drive into town. Room was clean & the of a good size. Bathroom door had no handle on the inside so it was a bit of a problem having to sort of flick the door open.
reviews.title: Ok for a night

reviews.text: As there is no eating or bar area breakfast is room service only. We went next door to the service center were there are ample choices for dinner & breakfast. Our room was on the groud floor so we could hear people walking around on the 1st floor. Also if we opened the curtains anyone walking past could see directly into the room.
reviews.title: ok but only ok

reviews.text: Overall for the price (50 pound) it was fair value.
reviews.title: Dayinn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed hear last week , location is just off motorway , the rooms are ok not great but clean. make sure you put your car reg down so you dont get a ticket. the staff at reception were very good and helpful.
reviews.title: Average hotel

reviews.text: i paid £65 for the room which is not bad for the location. one bad point is there is no on site eatting facilty. next door in the services is KFC , costa etc but not a nice place you can relax with a meal and a beer. even with the fact it is on motorway noise is ok.
reviews.title: Very clean, but not very roomy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great rooms,excellant location,great value and they take dogs,we'll be back
reviews.title: Excellant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a little outside of Headington in Oxford however very close via the buses. The staff here are very pleasant. The rooms are very comfy and spacious. Love the store and food court next door a major plus. No complaints at all!
reviews.title: Very Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I was not expecting much but this place was actually quite good! I agree with others it is not Oxford central, but I had checked this before booking in and it was 5 minutes from where I needed to be, hence my booking. I paid some bargain internet price of about £36. At the last minute, one of my fellow orchestra mates stayed over too so I rang and requested a twin room. The only criticism was that when we arrived, I was told it was a double plus a sofa bed so slightly annoyed as I had been assured it was a twin BUT it wasn't really a sofa bed - it was a perfectly good single bed as well as the double bed I had as far as I could see! The bathroom was nice, good shower. All the facilities you needed were there and then for breakfast we wandered over to the service area where we bought some breakfast (as I ordered room only) which we ate outside by some lovely fountains. It was quite pleasant!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.text: This should not be considered an Oxford area hotel - too far away. The reservation system is unclear, so you might end up with a smoking room unexpectedly. Non-smoking rooms are on the ground floor, but if you are on a higher floor there is no elevator so you must haul your suitcases up the stairs. Check-in service at the hotel was poor and inefficient and the service area restaurants and coffee shops charge higher prices than they would if they weren't in a service area.
reviews.title: Did not meet expectations

reviews.text: A clean and functional Hotel in the service area of the M40. It does what it sa's on the tin and provides a good nights rest. Very friendly staff and free WiFi. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel/Motel
reviews.title: A Good place to stop

reviews.text: If you have a vehicle, I think this is a good hotel option for Oxford considering that there are not a lot of affordable or chain type hotel options in Oxford. We stayed here for three nights, and really like being able to walk next door to the Welcome Break for breakfast, snacks etc. Being located in the rest area does mean a bit more traffic, but we felt like they did a really good job of sound proofing and noise was never a problem for us.
reviews.title: Worked well for us

reviews.text: While located in a Motorway Services centre this hotel/motel is ideal for a one night stay. Select a quite room on the top floor at the end of the building away from the shops and motorway. No breakfast provided within the hotel. However, a simple breakfast can be ordered or a voucher purchased for food within the service area (too expensive for what you get). Good value if you book on line. Staff were very helpful. Not a hotel to stay for an extended period, but good for a one night stay over. Good location if you are visiting Oxford, 10 - 15 mins by car. Sleep quality 6/10 with surprisingly limited street noise, given the location. It this hotel adopted the food options of the "Country Inns and Suites" in the USA if would be more successful.
reviews.title: OK in Oxford

reviews.text: As we live in Lancashire, we had an overnight stay at the 'Days Inn Oxford' on our way to Legoland, Windsor.
reviews.title: Our Trip to Legoland

reviews.text: The room and bathroom were really clean and the staff were exceptionally helpful.
reviews.title: One of the best Days Inn in the UK

reviews.text: Our breakfasts were lovely.
reviews.title: stay away

reviews.text: I really wasn't expecting much when I booked this hotel through laterooms.com, for myself, partner and our 8 year old son, we paid £50 for 2 nights, so obviously as it was such a great deal was very aprehensive....I needn't have worried, it was excellent, the staff were extremely friendly, the hotel was clean and very comfortable, I was also worried about the noise, as it is a motel and I am a very light sleeper, again I was very surprised how quiet it was....we would definitely stay here again if in the area.....EXCELLENT!!
reviews.title: Much more than I expeceted!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a night, booked it online with Lastminute weeks ago for outstanding value. Room overlooked quiet car park. Most comfortable beds. Suzi at Reception very helpful with ideas regarding parking in town.Will return again, when visiting the area
reviews.title: Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: Next door at the service station wide choice of breakfasts, quite pricey.
reviews.title: A Pleasant surprise

reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much from a hotel on a motorway service area but I was pleasantly surprised. Not many facilities but the room was clean and comfortable, in fact I enjoyed the best nights sleep in a hotel for quite some time. That after all is what this tye of establishment is all about!
reviews.title: such good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having to use the service area restauraunt for evening meal and breakfast is not very welcoming but the food quality was actualy very good.
reviews.title: Good Value for money and yet surprised

description: Days Inn Hotel Oxford is 6 miles from Oxford city centre and located off junction 8A of the M40 motorway. It has free Wi-Fi and free parking. The convenient hotel has spacious en-suite rooms and a 24-hour reception. Next to the hotel is the Welcome Break service area, with shops and restaurants including Burger King, KFC, Eat In, Coffee Primo, WHSmith and Waitrose. Each room has a bath and a shower, tea/coffee, Freeview TV, a telephone and a free newspaper. Pets are permitted at the hotel. Nearby attractions include Blenheim Palace, Waterperry Gardens, Cotswold Villages and Bicester Village designer shopping outlet.
